question: Match the compounds given in List – I with the items given in List – II.
List – I: (I) Benzenesulphonyl Chloride, (II) Sulphanilic acid, (III) Alkyl Diazonium salts, (IV) Aryl Diazonium salts
List – II: (a) Zwitterion, (b) Hinsberg reagent, (c) Dyes, (d) Conversion to alcohols
choices: I – c, II – b, III – a, IV – d
I – a, II – c, III – b, IV – d
I – c, II – a, III – d, IV – b
I – b, II – a, III – d, IV – c
explanation: Benzenesulphonyl chloride is Hinsberg reagent (b). Sulphanilic acid exists as Zwitterion (a). Alkyl diazonium salts convert to alcohols (d). Aryl diazonium salts form Dyes (c) [cite: 997-1000].
